defense_tackles.sentence: William Gay saw a slant route coming in zone coverage and intercepted the pass around the Steelers' 20-yard line.

1.comment: William Gay saw a slant route coming in zone coverage and intercepted the pass around the Steelers' 20-yard line. Pittsburgh controlled the ball and ran the clock out. For the game, Roethlisberger completed 21-of-33 passes for 245 yards with a touchdown and an interception. Mendenhall ran for 44 yards on 16 carries with 2 scores. Brown led the Steelers in receiving with 86 yards on 5 receptions. Wallace caught 5 for 54 yards with 2 runs for 31 yards. Dalton played better than his numbers indicate. He was 15-of-30 for 170 yards with 2 touchdowns and 2 interceptions. Benson had 57 yards on 15 carries. defense_interception_yards.sentence: William Gay, putting the score at 23-7 Pittsburgh.

4.comment: William Gay, putting the score at 23-7 Pittsburgh. And by the time McCarron threw his second touchdown, the game was already over.    Roethlisberger, despite completing 30-for-39 passes for 282 yards, did not throw a touchdown and was intercepted once. But he did look sharp all game and led his team into Bengals' territory over and over again. Williams was the beneficiary, with 2 touchdown runs, as he rushed 23 times for 76 yards and caught 2 passes for 15 more.    Heath Miller returned from his rib injury and was the chain mover all game, as he caught 10-of-10 targets for 66 yards. That's not much in yards per catch, but it is the definition of a quarterback's security blanket. That left the team's 2 most explosive players, finishing with not-so explosive numbers, with Antonio Brown totaling 87 yards and no touchdowns on 7 receptions and Gay, putting the score at 23-7 Pittsburgh.
